Posts.Content: Hi Michael, He plans on using PSA and Scans. As I mentioned, I am pretty sure he is going to put me on Xtandi or Zytiga. I want know till my next visist the end of May.

Posts.Title: Update - Provenge Therapy Completed

Posts.Content: Thought I would post this information to help someone who is considering the Provenge therapy. I began my process on Monday April 10th with infusions of my cells on Thursdays of each week. April 27th was my last day and I was able to complete the process in 3 straight weeks. Reason being, my veins were not good enough to handle the process so they put in a temporary port which allowed me to go each week instead of every other week. My only side affects was being very tired and fatigued after having the white cells removed and also on the days I received my infusions. Removing the port was somewhat strange. I chose not to receive anything to take off the edge. They put a lot of pressure in the area the port, pulled really hard, heard a pop and out it came. They also took blood for a PSA which they called this morning and said it was 4.54. I was expecting much higher if you read my stats and also many patients have much higher PSA with Provenge. Have an appointment the end of May which they may prescribe additional meds. I have a lot of hope the Provenge will work for me and others who decide upon this treatment. As our Brother Todd Seals well stated, " we need all the bullets we can get".

Posts.Title: Approved for Provenge

Posts.Content: Thanks RobLee. When I see the support that comes from individuals such as yourself, HighlanderCFH, MichiganMan16 and others that gather at this meeting place, that is some of the best therapy a man can get. Thanks...Lee
Posts.Title: Approved for Provenge

Posts.Content: Just a quick update. I was approved for the Provenge therapy which I will start in a couple of weeks. It appears my veins can't support the procedure so they must connect a apheresis catheter in my chest. When I read about Provenge, you really get a mixed bag of comments. In turn, you begin to question whether this treatment is right for your situation. It reminds me of movie Forrest Gump and his quote of "Mama always said life is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get." In my case and others like myself, we have to hope we made the right choice. After reading Todd Seals blog, "Living with Prostate Cancer", I decided I wanted to use every bullet in my arsenal to defeat this disease that we all hate. If you haven't read his blog, I urge everyone to do so. Lee

Posts.Title: Anybody taking Provenge?

Posts.Content: I recently had a visit with my Internist. They did a blood workup at which time they also discovered my PSA had went up along with other issues. (see my stats). Has anyone experienced this? They seemed to think everything was because of a rising PSA and metastasis was discovered. What concerns me is the the following blood results: My: MCV 103.9 High Ref Range: 83.9-98.7 My: MCH 34.7 High Ref Range: 25.0-33.0 My: PLT 130 Low Ref Range: 131-435 My: Neu% 76.1 High Ref Range: 39.3-73.7 My: Lymph% 14.4 Low Ref Range: 18.0-48.3 My: Lymph# 1.05 Low Ref Range: 1.09-2.99

Posts.Title: New here, Prostectomy complete

Posts.Content: My battle started a little over two years ago with prostate cancer. Since that time, I visited here frequently for information, but mostly the inspiration that was being offered by others. Why I did not register then i honestly don't know. Now I find myself even in more need as I will explain in my next post after I learn the ropes. I am trying to learn how to navigate and post my stats etc. Lee
Posts.Title: Long Time Vistor but a Newbie

Posts.Content: Hi Steve135. Thanks for the welcome aboard. Like everyone else, I certainly don't want to be here, but under our circumstances and the cards we all have been dealt, it sure is comforting to converse with others and befriend each other on our journey. Once again thanks...wish you the very best and hope to see you again. Lee

My wife says the Lupron was started in July 2015 before the 39 radiation treatments. Doctors record shows otherwise. I would like to ask a couple things but don't want to feel stupid. What is a MO and also a RO? Your suggestion for presenting my stats would be very helpful. Thanks....Lee

Posts.Title: Roller Coaster Getting Bumpy last few weeks

Posts.Content: Dave, good to see someone from my neck of the woods with a inspiring message. I lived in Bartlett for years until a divorce. I presently live in Cordova with my Fiancee' of 18yrs. Your message was very uplifting. When I received my biopsy 2&1/2 yrs ago., I was shook up. This time it really rattled my cage. My first thoughts were what did I do wrong? How can all this blow up the way it did in a matter of a few weeks? My Urologist is McSwain @ Conrad Pearson Group. He did the surgery and has been treating me. I have an appointment with him and Dr. Eber today. It was going to take 2 weeks to see him with my bone scan results, and my Internist pursued my bone scan results with a followup CT Scan for their records. They also made an appointment for me @ West Cancer Clinic with Dr. Tian on the 27th. Want to hear what my Urologist has to say and let him know I am getting a second opinion for treatments. We should get together and have a cup of coffee sometime when it's convenient. I will also keep you in my prayers. God can heal us of this dreaded disease if it is his will. Amen

Posts.Title: Roller Coaster Getting Bumpy last few weeks

Posts.Content: Thanks to you guys for the Welcome aboard and support. Here is my situation which is in my stats below. Went from being o.k with hormone therapy Lupron and No Bone mets, to suddenly off the tracks and now have mets in one location and PSA has gone crazy. Been using Urologist only until now. Have an appointment with oncologist end of month. Anybody heard of a such a big turn around that suddenly?

Possible re-occurrence. less than .02%< 7/2015 PSA: 0.63 07/2015 Began 39 treatments of radiation. 11/02/2015 PSA: 3.53 11/2015: Started Lupron. 02/2016 PSA: 0.55 5/2016 PSA: 0.40 08/2016 PSA: 0.38 11/2016 PSA: 0.79 12/2016: Started Prolia. 02/2017 PSA: 2.76 Cystoscopy 02/2017 Check blood in urine. Infection only. 03/2017 PSA: 4.03 Bone Scan: 3/1/2017. Possible metastatic disease. 3/9/2017 CT Scan confirmed metastatic disease Sternum 3cm in size. 4/27/2017 Completed Provenge. 4/27/2017 PSA: 4.54

Posts.Content: Hi MichiganMan16. I appreciate your response. Means a lot to me at this moment since my head is going crazy. My wife says the Lupron was started in July 2015 before the 39 radiation treatments. Doctors record shows otherwise. I would like to ask a couple things but don't want to feel stupid. What is a MO and also a RO? Your suggestion for presenting my stats would be very helpful. Thanks....Lee

Posts.Title: Roller Coaster Getting Bumpy last few weeks

Posts.Content: Dave, good to see someone from my neck of the woods with a inspiring message. I lived in Bartlett for years until a divorce. I presently live in Cordova with my Fiancee' of 18yrs. Your message was very uplifting. When I received my biopsy 2&1/2 yrs ago., I was shook up. This time it really rattled my cage. My first thoughts were what did I do wrong? How can all this blow up the way it did in a matter of a few weeks? My Urologist is McSwain @ Conrad Pearson Group. He did the surgery and has been treating me. I have an appointment with him and Dr. Eber today. It was going to take 2 weeks to see him with my bone scan results, and my Internist pursued my bone scan results with a followup CT Scan for their records. They also made an appointment for me @ West Cancer Clinic with Dr. Tian on the 27th. Want to hear what my Urologist has to say and let him know I am getting a second opinion for treatments. We should get together and have a cup of coffee sometime when it's convenient. I will also keep you in my prayers. God can heal us of this dreaded disease if it is his will. Amen
